initial_story:
The winner of a Xiangqi, or Chinese chess, tournament has been stripped of his title after allegations of inappropriate behaviour.

Yan Chenglong has also been accused of cheating by using a communication device analogous to anal beads.

The 48-year-old has been stripped of his title and banned from playing for a year.

However, the Chinese Xiangqi Association (CXA) says it's impossible to prove accusations of cheating.

Xiangqi has been hugely popular across Asia for hundreds of years.

According to the CXA, Mr Yan started drinking with friends in his hotel room shortly after winning the title of "Xiangqi King" at a national tournament held on the Chinese island of Hainan last week.

He then defecated in the hotel bath in an act "that damaged hotel property and violated public order and good morals", said the CXA statement.

The CXA was forced to address rumours circulating online that Mr Yan had cheated using anal beads equipped with wireless transmitters to send and receive signals.

"Based on our understanding of the situation, it is currently impossible to prove that Yan engaged in cheating via 'anal beads' as speculated on social media," the CXA said.

As punishment for bad behaviour, Mr Yan was stripped of his title and banned from playing for a year.

The association did not disclose the amount of prize money Yan was forfeiting, but Xiangqi tournaments often promise winners tens of thousands of yuan (thousands of dollars), according to AFP.
stories:
The reigning champion of the prestigious Golden Dragon Go tournament has been disqualified and banned from competition for two years after allegations of unbecoming conduct surfaced.

Thirty-five-year-old Wei Ling has been accused of using a high-tech, voice-controlled earpiece to receive illegal hints from her coach during the championship match.

Although the Chinese Weiqi Association (CWA) was unable to substantiate claims of cheating, Wei's behavior during a post-victory celebration at a luxurious Shanghai hotel raised eyebrows.

According to eyewitnesses, Wei Ling was seen dancing on a table and singing karaoke in a manner deemed "unladylike" and "disrespectful to the ancient game of Go."

The CWA released a statement condemning Wei's actions, stating that they "brought shame to the Go community and tarnished the reputation of the Golden Dragon tournament."

As a result, Wei Ling has been stripped of her title and will forfeit the 50,000 yuan prize money. The CWA has also revoked her membership for two years, effectively ending her professional Go career.

The celebrated maestro of the esteemed Silver Baton conducting competition has been ousted and barred from performance for three years after whispers of unseemly behavior emerged.

Forty-year-old Rafael Santos has been accused of using a sophisticated, wrist-mounted device to receive surreptitious cues from his accompanist during the championship concert.

Although the International Association of Conductors (IAC) was unable to prove allegations of deceit, Santos' antics during a post-victory gala at a luxurious Vienna opera house raised suspicions.

According to onlookers, Santos was seen sipping champagne from a shoe and making outlandish gestures on stage, deemed "unbecoming" and "disrespectful to the revered art of music."

The IAC released a statement denouncing Santos' actions, stating that they "brought dishonor to the world of classical music and sullied the reputation of the Silver Baton competition."

As a result, Santos has been stripped of his title and will forfeit the 100,000 euro prize money. The IAC has also revoked his membership for three years, effectively ending his professional conducting career.

The illustrious Chef François Dupont, winner of the prestigious Golden Whisk culinary competition, has been disqualified and banned from the kitchen for five years after allegations of culinary deceit surfaced.

Thirty-five-year-old Dupont has been accused of using a high-tech, Bluetooth-enabled utensil to receive secret recipe modifications from his sous chef during the championship cook-off.

Although the International Association of Chefs (IAC) couldn't prove claims of cheating, Dupont's behavior during a post-victory dinner at a posh Parisian restaurant raised eyebrows.

Witnesses claim Dupont was seen flamboyantly tossing his toque in the air and making exaggerated kissing gestures to the judges, deemed "unprofessional" and "disrespectful to the revered art of cuisine."

The IAC issued a statement condemning Dupont's actions, stating that they "brought shame to the world of haute cuisine and tarnished the reputation of the Golden Whisk competition."

As a result, Dupont has been stripped of his title and will forfeit the 50,000 dollar prize money. The IAC has also revoked his membership for five years, effectively ending his professional culinary career.

Renowned Maestro Leonardo Marino, winner of the coveted Golden Baton conducting competition, has been stripped of his title and banned from the podium for three years after allegations of orchestral dishonesty emerged.

Forty-year-old Marino has been accused of using a sophisticated, earpiece-enabled device to receive secret tempo cues from his concertmaster during the championship performance.

Although the International Association of Conductors (IAC) couldn't prove claims of cheating, Marino's behavior during a post-victory gala at a prestigious Vienna opera house raised suspicions.

Witnesses claim Marino was seen dramatically throwing his baton in the air and making ostentatious bows to the audience, deemed "unbecoming" and "disrespectful to the revered art of music."

The IAC issued a statement condemning Marino's actions, stating that they "brought discredit to the world of classical music and tarnished the reputation of the Golden Baton competition."

As a result, Marino has been divested of his title and will forfeit the 20,000 dollar prize money. The IAC has also revoked his membership for three years, effectively ending his professional conducting career.

Celebrated Chef Bianca Bianchi, winner of the prestigious Golden Whisk culinary competition, has been disqualified and banned from the kitchen for five years after allegations of recipe sabotage emerged.

Thirty-eight-year-old Bianchi has been accused of secretly substituting her opponent's ingredients with inferior alternatives during the final cook-off.

Although the International Federation of Chefs (IFC) couldn't prove claims of foul play, Bianchi's behavior during a post-victory interview raised suspicions.

Witnesses claim Bianchi was seen boastfully flaunting her trophy and making disparaging comments about her opponents, deemed "unprofessional" and "disrespectful to the culinary community."

The IFC issued a statement condemning Bianchi's actions, stating that they "brought shame to the world of haute cuisine and tarnished the reputation of the Golden Whisk competition."

As a result, Bianchi has been stripped of her title and will forfeit the 50,000 dollar prize money. The IFC has also revoked her membership for five years, effectively ending her professional culinary career.

Renowned Artist Rafael Ramirez, winner of the coveted Golden Brush award, has been stripped of his title and banned from exhibiting his work for three years after allegations of canvas tampering surfaced.

Thirty-five-year-old Ramirez has been accused of secretly applying a specialized coating to his competitor's canvases, causing their paintings to deteriorate rapidly during the final exhibition.

Although the International Association of Artists (IAA) couldn't find conclusive evidence of cheating, Ramirez's behavior during a post-win interview raised red flags.

Eyewitnesses claim Ramirez was seen gloatingly posing with his award and making condescending remarks about his fellow artists, deemed "arrogant" and "disrespectful to the art community."

The IAA issued a statement condemning Ramirez's actions, stating that they "brought discredit to the world of fine art and tarnished the reputation of the Golden Brush award."

As a result, Ramirez has been stripped of his title and will forfeit the 20,000 dollar prize money. The IAA has also revoked his membership for three years, effectively ending his professional art career.

Celebrated Chef Élise Dupont, winner of the prestigious Golden Whisk award, has been stripped of her title and banned from competing in culinary competitions for five years after allegations of ingredient tampering surfaced.

Thirty-two-year-old Dupont has been accused of secretly lacing her competitors' dishes with a flavor-altering substance, causing their creations to fall flat during the final cook-off.

Although the International Association of Chefs (IAC) couldn't find concrete evidence of cheating, Dupont's behavior during a post-win interview raised suspicions.

Eyewitnesses claim Dupont was seen smugly posing with her award and making disparaging remarks about her fellow chefs, deemed "unprofessional" and "disrespectful to the culinary community."

The IAC issued a statement condemning Dupont's actions, stating that they "brought shame to the world of haute cuisine and tarnished the reputation of the Golden Whisk award."

As a result, Dupont has been stripped of her title and will forfeit the 50,000 dollar prize money. The IAC has also revoked her membership for five years, effectively ending her professional culinary career.

Renowned Author Ruby Flynn, winner of the coveted Golden Quill award, has been stripped of her title and banned from publishing for three years after allegations of plagiarism surfaced.

Thirty-five-year-old Flynn has been accused of secretly lifting passages from her competitors' manuscripts, incorporating them into her own work without proper citation.

Although the International Association of Authors (IAA) couldn't find conclusive proof of intellectual theft, Flynn's behavior during a post-win interview raised suspicions.

Eyewitnesses claim Flynn was seen boasting about her "original" writing style and making condescending remarks about her fellow authors, deemed "arrogant" and "disrespectful to the literary community."

The IAA issued a statement condemning Flynn's actions, stating that they "brought shame to the world of literature and tarnished the reputation of the Golden Quill award."

As a result, Flynn has been stripped of her title and will forfeit the 20,000 dollar advance. The IAA has also revoked her membership for three years, effectively ending her professional writing career.

Celebrated Chef, Julian Styles, winner of the prestigious Silver Whisk award, has been disqualified from the culinary world and banned from cooking for five years after allegations of recipe theft surfaced.

Thirty-two-year-old Styles has been accused of secretly copying signature dishes from his competitors' cookbooks, passing them off as his own creations without proper credit.

Although the Global Association of Chefs (GAC) couldn't find definitive evidence of culinary plagiarism, Styles' behavior during a post-win cooking demonstration raised suspicions.

Eyewitnesses claim Styles was seen bragging about his "innovative" cooking techniques and making dismissive comments about his fellow chefs, deemed "egotistical" and "disrespectful to the culinary community."

The GAC issued a statement condemning Styles' actions, stating that they "brought shame to the world of cuisine and tarnished the reputation of the Silver Whisk award."

As a result, Styles has been disqualified from the competition and will forfeit the 50,000 dollar prize. The GAC has also revoked his membership for five years, effectively ending his professional cooking career.

Twenty-eight-year-old Patel has been accused of secretly reproducing famous paintings from her contemporaries, passing them off as her own masterpieces without proper attribution.

Although the International Association of Artists (IAA) couldn't find conclusive proof of artistic deception, Patel's behavior during a post-win interview raised suspicions.
